PMAU.text:
SPMAU
Kgim SMP/E
TPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-015102
*
@IBM Corporation
*
Uhttps://www-03.ibm.com/systems/z/os/zos/features/smpe/pma/
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NOverview
N--------
NThe Planning and Migration Assistant (PMA) helps you to identify
Nproducts that are currently installed on your system and provide
Nplanning information that can be useful in migration.
N
NPMA provides reports that you can customize to show:
N
N-> Target, Distribution, and Global CSI Zone Names
N
N-> Order numbers in your CustomPac Order Inventories
N
N-> Products installed in a set of target zones
N
N-> Comparative information about products currently installed on your
N   system and the highest level of the products currently available
N   for ordering
N
N-> Comparative information about products currently installed on your
N   system and more current levels you might be migrating to
N
NPMA is provided as part of SMP/E.
N
NPMA uses a Software Information Base to provide information about IBM
Nproducts, their functional history and progression, and other data
Nfurther describing products available in z/OS and the other subsystems
N- including CICS, DB2, IMS, and NCP. The Software Information Base is
Nupdated regularly to reflect the most current data about announced
Nproducts.
* End of WISH.

PMAUCF.text:
SPMAUCF
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION
TPMA
T-Chapter CF. Configuration
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-014453
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter CF. Configuration
N-------------------------
IAppeared with OS/390 V1R7. Documentation is Web based.
N
NAvoid needlessly adding concatenated data sets by doing
Nsome simple setup and copying the sample reports to do
Ninstallation specific tailoring at your shop.
N
NFirst, allocate some datasets. Then get the most current
NSoftware Information Base or order the latest PTF.
M
MTo find and order the latest PTF for the Software Information Base,
Muse the IBM Technical help database or follow your local procedures
Mfor ordering service. You can also search RETAIN to identify the
MSoftware Information Base PTFs using the search argument PMAIB
M(PMA Software Information Base).
M
NMy early experience trying to run the REXX code was fraught with
NS80A abend. That was a long time ago. It won't hurt to go the PTF
Nroute.
* End of WISH.

PMAUCF01.text:
SPMAUCF01
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION
TPMA
T-Chapter CF.
T-PMAUCF01 - Allocate a PDSE for the reports and tables
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-014034
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter CF. Configuration
N-------------------------
NPMAUCF01 - Allocate a PDSE for the REPORTS and ISPF Tables
N----------------------------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAUCF01
D//* Guide:  This step allocates a PDSE for the reports and tables.
D//*
D//ST01#01 EXEC PGM=IEFBR14
D//ISPTABL   DD DISP=(NEW,CATLG),DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.TABLES,
D//             UNIT=3390,
D//             SPACE=(CYL,(75,75,9),RLSE),
D//             DCB=(DSORG=PO,RECFM=FB,BLKSIZE=0,LRECL=80)
D//REPORTS   DD DISP=(NEW,CATLG),DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.REPORTS,
D//             UNIT=SYSALLDA,
D//             SPACE=(TRK,(15,5,0),RLSE),
D//             DSNTYPE=LIBRARY,
D//             DCB=(DSORG=PO,RECFM=FB,BLKSIZE=0,LRECL=255)
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.

PMAUCF02.text:
SPMAUCF02
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION
TPMA
T-Chapter CF.
T_PMAUCF02 - FTP to get the most current BCN@INST
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-014543
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter CF. Configuration
N--------------------------
NPMAUCF02 - FTP to get the most current BCN@INST
N-----------------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAUCF02
D//* Guide:  This job will use FTP to get the most current BCN@INST.
D//*
D//* Use 'CAPS OFF' when editing as file names are mixed case
D//* Assumes TSO/e prefix is your userid
D//*
D//* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
D//* GET bcnitenu from IBM.
D//* <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
D//ST01#01 EXEC PGM=FTP,
D//             PARM='ftp.software.ibm.com ( EXIT'
D//OUTPUT    DD SYSOUT=*
D//INPUT     DD *
Danonymous ;
Dyour_email_address@your_mail-server_domain ;
Dcd s390/pma ;
Dls ;
Dbin ;
Dlocsite recfm=fb lrecl=80 blksize=0 cyl pri=20 sec=5 ;
Dget bcnitenu.bin SMPEPMA.BCN@INST ;
Dquit ;
D/*
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.

PMAUCF03.text:
SPMAUCF03
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION
TPMA
T-Chapter CF.
T-PMAUCF03 - Receive APAR maintenance from a file
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-014704
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter CF. Configuration
N--------------------------
NPMAUCF03 - Receive APAR maintenance from a file
N-----------------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAUCF03
D//* Guide:  This job will receive APAR maintenance from a file.
D//*
D//         SET HLQ=SMPE
D//*
D//ST01#01 EXEC PGM=GIMSMP
D//SMPCSI    DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&HLQ..GLOBAL.CSI      <== Your Global zone
D//SMPSNAP   DD DUMMY
D//SMPPTFIN  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.BCN@INST
D//SMPHOLD   DD DUMMY
D//SMPCNTL   DD *
D  SET
D    BOUNDARY(GLOBAL)
D  .
D    RECEIVE
D    .
D/*
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.

PMAURP.text:
SPMAURP
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION
TPMA
T-Chapter RP. Reports
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-015459
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter RP. Reports
N-------------------
NThis member describes which PDS member matches each report.
N
NThe reports are listed in the order they appear as options under
Nthe SMPE panel option 6.
N
NMember   Description
N-------- --------------------------------------------------------------
NPMAU$$IX This member
NPMAUCF01 Allocate a PDSE for the REPORTS and ISPF Tables.
NPMAUCF02 Ftp the latest APAR from IBM.
NPMAUCF03 Receive the apar.
N-------- --------------------------------------------------------------
NPMAURP01 All Zones in a CSI                                         1
NPMAURP02 All Order Numbers in CustomPac Inventory Files             2
NPMAURP03 Products Applied                                           3
NPMAURP04 Top Product Migration Changes                              4
NPMAURP05 Intermediate Product Migration Changes                     5
NPMAURP06 Prime FMID Descriptions in All Zones                       6
N-------- --------------------------------------------------------------
N
NHints on how to run the reports:
N--------------------------------
N 1) Research first:
N    a) Find your SMPE global CSI.
N       Ask, find a job that was used, or use ISPF 3.4
N       to search on **.CSI and bear the pain of searching every
N       catalog known in your master catalog. It helps if you know the
N       high level qualifier. Often, SMPE.**.CSI will work for you.
N       Some shops use CICS.**.CSI and DB2.**.CSI to split things up.
N
N    b) Find your CPAC order database.
N       Next, look at the way you invoke the CPAC dialog to find
N       the **.SCPPVENU dataset you use. If you need to, use ISPF 3.4
N       to search on **.SCPPVENU and bear the pain of searching every
N       catalog known in your master catalog. It helps if you know the
N       high level qualifier. Often, SMPE.**.SCPPVENU will work for you.
N
N 2) Go ahead and allocate the datasets for the REPORTS and ISPF
N    tables using PMAU$ALC as a starting point.
N
N 3) Start the ISPF based SMPE dialog.
N
N 4) Choose option 6.
N    6  MIGRATION ASSISTANT- Generate Planning and Migration Reports
N
N 5) Click the MENU bar Actions entry.
N
N    a) Choose option 1.
N       1. Configure
N
N    b) Add a jobcard to get stuffed on each job as you create them.
N
N    c) Enter the ISPF and SMPE datasets enclosed in apostrophes.
N
N    d) < page-down > to get all the configuration data options.
N
N 6) Know what you are working from.
N
N    a) Click the MENU bar Actions entry.
N
N    b) Choose option 2.
N       2. List date of Software Information Base
N
N    c) Review the dates.
N
N       +---------- Date of Software Information Base ----------+
N       |                                                       |
N       | Software Information Base data set name:              |
N       |    'SYS1.GIM.SGIMTENU'                                |
N       |                                                       |
N       | Date Software Information Base was generated:         |
N       |    -yyyy/mm/dd-=-yyyy.ddd--                           |
N       |     2006/11/20 = 2006.324                             |
N       |                                                       |
N       |                                                       |
N       +-------------------------------------------------------+
N
N       REALLY OUT OF DATE?
N       Try running PMAUCF02 to download the Software Information Base
N       directly to your system or use one of these sites to download
N       to your personal computer and then upload.
N
N         ftp://public.dhe.ibm.com/s390/pma/bcnitenu.bin
N
N  2017 https://www-03.ibm.com/systems/z/os/zos/features/smpe/pma/
N       The 18,275KB file on 2017-06-06 used 20 CYL.
N
N         ftp your-host-name
N         your-userid
N         your-password
N         bin
N         quote site recfm=fb lrecl=80 blksize=0
N         quote site cyl pri=25 sec=5
N         put bcnitenu.bin
N         quit
N
N       You can tailor PMAUCF03 to receive and apply the PTF or
N       attempt to run the REXX code.
N       Running the REXX code will result in the ignorable error:
I
I         IKJ79054I CLIST EXCEEDS MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE LENGTH
N
N    d) Click the MENU bar Actions entry.
N
N    e) Choose option 3.
N       3. List date of Migration Assistant Code
N
N       +---------- Date of Migration Assistant Code -----------+
N       |                                                       |
N       |                                                       |
N       |                                                       |
N       |                                                       |
N       | Level of Migration Assistant Code:                    |
N       |    -yyyy/mm/dd-=-yyyy.ddd--                           |
N       |     2000/07/07 = 2000.189                             |
N       |                                                       |
N       |                                                       |
N       +-------------------------------------------------------+
* End of WISH.

PMAURP00.text:
SPMAURP00
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION
TPMA
T-Chapter RP.
T-EVERY FREAKING ALLOCATED DATASET
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-015848
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter RP. Reports
N-------------------
NEVERY FREAKING ALLOCATED DATASET
N--------------------------------
NAhh, the failure of using the generate job on the SMP/E
Noption 6 path is that it adds EVERY FREAKING ALLOCATED DATASET
Nallocated to your ISPF session instead of JUST WHAT IT NEEDS.
N
NYou can tailor data set names in these jobs to not try and
Nwade through all the data sets you might have allocated.
N
NKudos to those shops that learned to strip down the TSO/E logon
NPROCedure and not stuff them in a startup clist/REXX program.
NThat leaves allocating (LIBDEF) on the fly for product specific
Ninvocations at the wiser installations. Yes, I know the trade-offs
Nbehind your opinion over allocating is best for you. That is why
NI carefully construct the LOGON sequence to favor those tools most
Noften used and relegate rarely used tools to LIBDEF.
M
MUse them, or not, makes no difference to me. I have been known to use
Mthe SMP/E Dialog Option 6 path to generate the control cards I then
Mcut and paste into my JCL.
* End of WISH.

PMAURP01.text:
SPMAURP01
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION BCN2ZNLR
TPMA
T-Chapter RP.
T-PMAURP01 - Option 1 All Zones in a CSI
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-015639
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter RP. Reports
N-------------------
NPMAURP01 - Option 1 All Zones in a CSI
N--------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAURP01
D//* Guide:  Option 1 All Zones in a CSI.
D//*
D//         SET HLQ=DB2
D//*
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//* Execute Migration Assistant dialog ZONELIST:
D//*  All Zones in a CSI
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//ST01#01 EXEC PGM=IKJEFT01,DYNAMNBR=40,REGION=0M,
D//             PARM=('ISPSTART CMD(%BCN2ZNLR )')
D//*-------ALLOCATE REPORT AND REPORT TABLES----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPTABL - data set that contains the ISPF table report results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPTABL   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.TABLES
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPFILE - data set that contains the browseable report
D//**           created from the ISPF table results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPFILE   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.REPORTS(ZONELIST)
D//*-------ALLOCATE PROFILE, LOG, PANELS, MSGS, ETC.--------------------
D//ISPPROF   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(1,1,1)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,BLKSIZE=0)
D//ISPWRK1   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(30,5)),
D//             DCB=(LRECL=256,BLKSIZE=2560,RECFM=FB)
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPLOG - Where ISPF puts error and informational messages.
D//**          Specify DUMMY if not needed.
D//**          For debugging purposes specify SYSOUT=*,DCB=(RECFM=VA,
D//**          LRECL=125,BLKSIZE=129)
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPLOG    DD DUMMY
D//ISPLLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMLMD0
D//ISPMLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPMENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMMENU
D//ISPPLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPPENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMPENU
D//ISPSLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPSLIB
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMSENU
D//ISPTLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPTENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMTENU
D//SYSEXEC   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPEXEC
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMCLS0
D//*-------ALLOCATE TSO INPUT AND OUTPUT FILES--------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSPRT - Where TSO puts error and informational messages.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSPRT  DD SYSOUT=*
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSIN - Input for TSO.  This should be DUMMY because all input
D//**           is being passed as part of the 'PARM =' statement on the
D//**           EXEC card.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSIN   DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE GLOBAL CSI DATA SET-----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SMPCSI - SMP/E CSI containing the global zone that the report will
D//**          be run against.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SMPCSI    DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&HLQ..GLOBAL.CSI
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.

PMAURP02.text:
SPMAURP02
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION BCN2ORNR
TPMA
T-Chapter RP.
T-PMAURP02 - Option 2 All Order Numbers in CustomPac Inventory Files
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-020005
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter RP. Reports
N-------------------
NPMAURP02 - Option 2 All Order Numbers in CustomPac Inventory Files
N------------------------------------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAURP02
D//* Guide:  Option 2 All Order Numbers in CustomPac Inventory Files.
D//*
D//         SET HLQ=DB2
D//*
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//* Execute Migration Assistant dialog ORDRLIST:
D//*  All Order Numbers in CustomPac Inventory Files
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//ST01#01 EXEC PGM=IKJEFT01,DYNAMNBR=40,REGION=0M,
D//             PARM=('ISPSTART CMD(%BCN2ORNR )')
D//*-------ALLOCATE REPORT AND REPORT TABLES----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPTABL - data set that contains the ISPF table report results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPTABL   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.TABLES
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPFILE - data set that contains the browseable report
D//**           created from the ISPF table results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPFILE   DD DISP=OLD,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.REPORTS(ORDRLIST)
D//*-------ALLOCATE PROFILE, LOG, PANELS, MSGS, ETC.--------------------
D//ISPPROF   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(1,1,1)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,BLKSIZE=0)
D//ISPWRK1   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(30,5)),
D//             DCB=(LRECL=256,BLKSIZE=2560,RECFM=FB)
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPLOG - Where ISPF puts error and informational messages.
D//**          Specify DUMMY if not needed.
D//**          For debugging purposes specify SYSOUT=*,DCB=(RECFM=VA,
D//**          LRECL=125,BLKSIZE=129)
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPLOG    DD DUMMY
D//ISPLLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMLMD0
D//ISPMLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPMENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMMENU
D//ISPPLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPPENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMPENU
D//ISPSLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPSLIB
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMSENU
D//ISPTLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPTENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMTENU
D//SYSEXEC   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPEXEC
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMCLS0
D//*-------ALLOCATE TSO INPUT AND OUTPUT FILES--------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSPRT - Where TSO puts error and informational messages.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSPRT  DD SYSOUT=*
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSIN - Input for TSO.  This should be DUMMY because all input
D//**           is being passed as part of the 'PARM =' statement on the
D//**           EXEC card.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSIN   DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE CUSTOMPAC ORDER INVENTORY FILES---------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SPACFILn - Name of the VSAM CustomPac Order Inventory File where
D//**            n=1 to 7.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SPACFIL1  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&HLQ..CPAC.SCPPVENU
D//SPACFIL2  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL3  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL4  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL5  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL6  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL7  DD DUMMY
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.

PMAURP03.text:
SPMAURP03
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION BCN2APRR
TPMA
T-Chapter RP.
T-PMAURP03 - Option 3 Products Applied
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-020051
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter RP. Reports
N-------------------
NPMAURP03 - Option 3 Products Applied
N------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAURP03
D//* Guide:  Option 3 Products Applied.
D//*
D//         SET HLQ=DB2
D//*
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//* Execute Migration Assistant dialog APLYPROD:
D//*  Products Applied
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//ST01#01 EXEC PGM=IKJEFT01,DYNAMNBR=40,REGION=0M,
D//             PARM=('ISPSTART CMD(%BCN2APRR )')
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE INFORMATION BASE TABLES-------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** IBASDATA - data set that contains the Software Information
D//**            Base.
D//*********************************************************************
D//IBASDATA  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.BASE
D//*-------ALLOCATE REPORT AND REPORT TABLES----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPTABL - data set that contains the ISPF table report results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPTABL   DD DISP=OLD,DSN=&SYSUID..COR.TABLES
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPFILE - data set that contains the browseable report
D//**           created from the ISPF table results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPFILE   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.REPORTS(APLYPROD)
D//*-------ALLOCATE PROFILE, LOG, PANELS, MSGS, ETC.--------------------
D//ISPPROF   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(1,1,1)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,BLKSIZE=0)
D//ISPWRK1   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(30,5)),
D//             DCB=(LRECL=256,BLKSIZE=2560,RECFM=FB)
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPLOG - Where ISPF puts error and informational messages.
D//**          Specify DUMMY if not needed.
D//**          For debugging purposes specify SYSOUT=*,DCB=(RECFM=VA,
D//**          LRECL=125,BLKSIZE=129)
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPLOG    DD DUMMY
D//ISPLLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMLMD0
D//ISPMLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPMENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMMENU
D//ISPPLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPPENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMPENU
D//ISPSLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPSLIB
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMSENU
D//ISPTLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPTENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMTENU
D//SYSEXEC   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPEXEC
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMCLS0
D//*-------ALLOCATE TSO INPUT AND OUTPUT FILES--------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSPRT - Where TSO puts error and informational messages.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSPRT  DD SYSOUT=*
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSIN - Input for TSO.  This should be DUMMY because all input
D//**           is being passed as part of the 'PARM =' statement on the
D//**           EXEC card.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSIN   DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE GLOBAL CSI DATA SET-----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SMPCSI - SMP/E CSI containing the global zone that the report will
D//**          be run against.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SMPCSI    DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&HLQ..GLOBAL.CSI
D//*-------ALLOCATE A LIST OF TARGET ZONES TO PROCESS-------------------
D//TRGTZONE  DD DUMMY
D//TRGTZONE  DD *             Example if you limit the report
D  TZONE81
D  TZWRS91
D/*
D//*-------ALLOCATE CUSTOMPAC ORDER INVENTORY FILES---------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SPACFILn - Name of the VSAM CustomPac Order Inventory File where
D//**            n=1 to 7.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SPACFIL1  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&HLQ..CPAC.SCPPVENU
D//SPACFIL2  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL3  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL4  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL5  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL6  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL7  DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE A LIST OF ORDER NUMBERS TO PROCESS------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SPACORDR - List of order numbers to report on. If no order numbers
D//**            are specified, no order information will be included in
D//**            the report.  If ALL is specified, all orders found in
D//**            the CustomPac order inventory files will be included.
D//**            The CustomPac order inventory files are specified by
D//**            the DDNAMEs SPACFILn.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SPACORDR  DD *
D  ALL
D/*
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.

PMAURP04.text:
SPMAURP04
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION BCN2PMCR
TPMA
T-Chapter RP.
T-PMAURP04 - Option 4 Top Product Migration Changes
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-020132
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter RP. Reports
N-------------------
NPMAURP04 - Option 4 Top Product Migration Changes
N-------------------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAURP04
D//* Guide:  Option 4 Top Product Migration Changes.
D//*
D//         SET HLQ=DB2
D//*
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//* Execute Migration Assistant dialog PRODCHG:
D//*  Top Product Migration Changes
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//ST01#01 EXEC PGM=IKJEFT1B,DYNAMNBR=40,REGION=0M,
D//             PARM=('ISPSTART CMD(%BCN2PMCR )')
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE INFORMATION BASE TABLES-------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** IBASDATA - data set that contains the Software Information
D//**            Base.
D//*********************************************************************
D//IBASDATA  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.BASE
D//*-------ALLOCATE REPORT AND REPORT TABLES----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPTABL - data set that contains the ISPF table report results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPTABL   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.TABLES
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPFILE - data set that contains the browseable report
D//**           created from the ISPF table results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPFILE   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.REPORTS(PRODCHG)
D//*-------ALLOCATE PROFILE, LOG, PANELS, MSGS, ETC.--------------------
D//ISPPROF   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(1,1,1)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,BLKSIZE=0)
D//ISPWRK1   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(30,5)),
D//             DCB=(LRECL=256,BLKSIZE=2560,RECFM=FB)
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPLOG - Where ISPF puts error and informational messages.
D//**          Specify DUMMY if not needed.
D//**          For debugging purposes specify SYSOUT=*,DCB=(RECFM=VA,
D//**          LRECL=125,BLKSIZE=129)
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPLOG    DD DUMMY
D//ISPLLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMLMD0
D//ISPMLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPMENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMMENU
D//ISPPLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPPENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMPENU
D//ISPSLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPSLIB
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMSENU
D//ISPTLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPTENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMTENU
D//SYSEXEC   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPEXEC
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMCLS0
D//*-------ALLOCATE TSO INPUT AND OUTPUT FILES--------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSPRT - Where TSO puts error and informational messages.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSPRT  DD SYSOUT=*
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSIN - Input for TSO.  This should be DUMMY because all input
D//**           is being passed as part of the 'PARM =' statement on the
D//**           EXEC card.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSIN   DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE GLOBAL CSI DATA SET-----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SMPCSI - SMP/E CSI containing the global zone that the report will
D//**          be run against.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SMPCSI    DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&HLQ..GLOBAL.CSI
D//*-------ALLOCATE A LIST OF TARGET ZONES TO PROCESS-------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** TRGTZONE - List of target zones to report on.  If none are
D//**            specified, all target zones in the SMP/E CSI will
D//**            be reported on.
D//*********************************************************************
D//TRGTZONE  DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE CUSTOMPAC ORDER INVENTORY FILES---------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SPACFILn - Name of the VSAM CustomPac Order Inventory File where
D//**            n=1 to 7.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SPACFIL1  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&HLQ..CPAC.SCPPVENU
D//SPACFIL2  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL3  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL4  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL5  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL6  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL7  DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE A LIST OF ORDER NUMBERS TO PROCESS------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SPACORDR - List of order numbers to report on.  If no order number
D//**            are specified, no order information will be included in
D//**            the report.  If ALL is specified, all orders found in
D//**            the CustomPac order inventory files will be included.
D//**            The CustomPac order inventory files are specified by
D//**            the DDNAMEs SPACFILn.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SPACORDR  DD DUMMY
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.

PMAURP05.text:
SPMAURP05
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION BCN2IPMR
TPMA
T-Chapter RP.
T-PMAURP05 - Option 5 Intermediate Product Migration Changes
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-020203
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter RP. Reports
N-------------------
NPMAURP05 - Option 5 Intermediate Product Migration Changes
N----------------------------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAURP05
D//* Guide:  Option 5 Intermediate Product Migration Changes
D//*         This job will report what products you should be looking
D//*         to upgrade to before support runs out.
D//*
D//*---------------------------------------------------------------------
D//* Execute Migration Assistant dialog IPRODCHG:
D//*  Intermediate Product Migration Changes
D//*---------------------------------------------------------------------
D//ST01#)1 EXEC PGM=IKJEFT01,DYNAMNBR=40,
D//             PARM=('ISPSTART CMD(%BCN2IPMR )')
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE INFORMATION BASE TABLES--------------------------
D//**********************************************************************
D//** IBASDATA - data set that contains the Software Information
D//**            Base.
D//**********************************************************************
D//IBASDATA  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.BASE
D//*-------ALLOCATE REPORT AND REPORT TABLES-----------------------------
D//**********************************************************************
D//** ISPTABL - data set that contains the ISPF table report results.
D//**********************************************************************
D//ISPTABL   DD DISP=OLD,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.TABLES
D//**********************************************************************
D//** ISPFILE - data set that contains the browseable report
D//**           created from the ISPF table results.
D//**********************************************************************
D//ISPFILE   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.REPORTS(IPRODCHG)
D//*-------ALLOCATE PROFILE, LOG, PANELS, MSGS, ETC.---------------------
D//ISPPROF   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(1,1,1)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,BLKSIZE=0)
D//ISPWRK1   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(30,5)),
D//             DCB=(LRECL=256,BLKSIZE=2560,RECFM=FB)
D//**********************************************************************
D//** ISPLOG - Where ISPF puts error and informational messages.
D//**          Specify DUMMY if not needed.
D//**          For debugging purposes specify SYSOUT=*,DCB=(RECFM=VA,
D//**          LRECL=125,BLKSIZE=129)
D//**********************************************************************
D//ISPLOG    DD DUMMY
D//ISPLLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMLMD0
D//ISPMLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPMENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMMENU
D//ISPPLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPPENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMPENU
D//ISPSLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPSLIB
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMSENU
D//ISPTLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPTENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMTENU
D//SYSEXEC   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPEXEC
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMCLS0
D//*-------ALLOCATE TSO INPUT AND OUTPUT FILES---------------------------
D//**********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSPRT - Where TSO puts error and informational messages.
D//**********************************************************************
D//SYSTSPRT  DD SYSOUT=*
D//**********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSIN - Input for TSO.  This should be DUMMY because all input
D//**           is being passed as part of the 'PARM =' statement on the
D//**           EXEC card.
D//**********************************************************************
D//SYSTSIN   DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE GLOBAL CSI DATA SET------------------------------
D//**********************************************************************
D//** SMPCSI - SMP/E CSI containing the global zone that the report will
D//**          be run against.
D//**********************************************************************
D//SMPCSI    DD DISP=SHR,DSN=DB2.GLOBAL.CSI
D//*-------ALLOCATE A LIST OF TARGET ZONES TO PROCESS--------------------
D//**********************************************************************
D//** TRGTZONE - List of target zones to report on.  If none are
D//**            specified, all target zones in the SMP/E CSI will
D//**            be reported on.
D//**********************************************************************
D//TRGTZONE  DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE CUSTOMPAC ORDER INVENTORY FILES----------------------
D//**********************************************************************
D//** SPACFILn - Name of the VSAM CustomPac Order Inventory File where
D//**            n=1 to 7.
D//**********************************************************************
D//SPACFIL1  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=DB2.CPAC.SCPPVENU
D//SPACFIL2  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL3  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL4  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL5  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL6  DD DUMMY
D//SPACFIL7  DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE A LIST OF ORDER NUMBERS TO PROCESS-------------------
D//**********************************************************************
D//** SPACORDR - List of order numbers to report on.  If no order numbers
D//**            are specified, no order information will be included in
D//**            the report.  If ALL is specified, all orders found in
D//**            the CustomPac order inventory files will be included.
D//**            The CustomPac order inventory files are specified by
D//**            the DDNAMEs SPACFILn.
D//**********************************************************************
D//SPACORDR  DD *
D  ALL
D/*
D//*-------ALLOCATE PRODUCT/VRMS TO MIGRATE TO---------------------------
D//**********************************************************************
D//** MIGTO   - List of product/VRMs the user would like to migrate to.
D//**           Entered as product/VRM groups in the form pppp-ppp
D//**           vv.rr.mm where each group is separated by a blank or
D//**           comma.
D//**********************************************************************
D//MIGTO     DD DUMMY
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.

PMAURP06.text:
SPMAURP06
KBCN PLANNING MIGRATION BCN2FMDR
TPMA
T-Chapter RP.
T-PMAURP06 - Option 6 Prime FMID Descriptions in All Zones
E"Kenneth Tomiak"<CBT_Ken@KTomiak.BIZ>
Z20180514-020233
Whttp://www.ktomiak.biz/ORG/
@Kenneth Tomiak
*
NPlanning and Migration Assistant (PMA)
N--------------------------------------
NChapter RP. Reports
N-------------------
NPMAURP06 - Option 6 Prime FMID Descriptions in All Zones
N--------------------------------------------------------
D//* Source: PMAURP06
D//* Guide:  Option 6 Prime FMID Descriptions in All Zones.
D//*
D//         SET HLQ=DB2
D//*
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//* Execute Migration Assistant dialog FMIDDESC:
D//*  Prime FMID Descriptions in All Zones
D//*--------------------------------------------------------------------
D//ST01#01 EXEC PGM=IKJEFT01,DYNAMNBR=40,REGION=0M,
D//             PARM=('ISPSTART CMD(%BCN2FMDR )')
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE INFORMATION BASE TABLES-------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** IBASDATA - data set that contains the Software Information
D//**            Base.
D//*********************************************************************
D//IBASDATA  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.BASE
D//*-------ALLOCATE REPORT AND REPORT TABLES----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPTABL - data set that contains the ISPF table report results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPTABL   DD DISP=OLD,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.TABLES
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPFILE - data set that contains the browseable report
D//**           created from the ISPF table results.
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPFILE   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&SYSUID..SMPEPMA.REPORTS(FMIDDESC)
D//*-------ALLOCATE PROFILE, LOG, PANELS, MSGS, ETC.--------------------
D//ISPPROF   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(1,1,1)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,BLKSIZE=0)
D//ISPWRK1   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(TRK,(30,5)),
D//             DCB=(LRECL=256,BLKSIZE=2560,RECFM=FB)
D//*********************************************************************
D//** ISPLOG - Where ISPF puts error and informational messages.
D//**          Specify DUMMY if not needed.
D//**          For debugging purposes specify SYSOUT=*,DCB=(RECFM=VA,
D//**          LRECL=125,BLKSIZE=129)
D//*********************************************************************
D//ISPLOG    DD DUMMY
D//ISPLLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMLMD0
D//ISPMLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPMENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMMENU
D//ISPPLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPPENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMPENU
D//ISPSLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPSLIB
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMSENU
D//ISPTLIB   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPTENU
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMTENU
D//SYSEXEC   DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.ISP.SISPEXEC
D//          DD DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.GIM.SGIMCLS0
D//*-------ALLOCATE TSO INPUT AND OUTPUT FILES--------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSPRT - Where TSO puts error and informational messages.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSPRT  DD SYSOUT=*
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SYSTSIN - Input for TSO.  This should be DUMMY because all input
D//**           is being passed as part of the 'PARM =' statement on the
D//**           EXEC card.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SYSTSIN   DD DUMMY
D//*-------ALLOCATE THE GLOBAL CSI DATA SET-----------------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SMPCSI - SMP/E CSI containing the global zone that the report will
D//**          be run against.
D//*********************************************************************
D//SMPCSI    DD DISP=SHR,DSN=&HLQ..GLOBAL.CSI
D//*-------ALLOCATE FILES FOR SMP/E UCLIN PROCESSING--------------------
D//*********************************************************************
D//** SMPCNTL - Temporary data set to hold dynamically built SMP/E
D//**           commands to be processed.
D//** SMPOUT  - Contains messages issued during SMP/E processing.
D//**           Will be merged into DDNAME ISPFILE.
D//** SMPRPT  - Contains the reports produced during SMP/E processing.
D//**           Will be merged into DDNAME ISPFILE.
D//** SMPPTS  - Placeholder data set, needed for UCLIN for global  @02A
D//**           zone even though nothing is actually written to it @02A
D//** SMPLOG  - DUMMY Data set                                     @01A
D//** SMPLOGA - DUMMY Data set                                     @02A
D//** SMPSNAP - DUMMY Data set                                     @01A
D//*********************************************************************
D//SMPCNTL   DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(NEW,PASS),SPACE=(CYL,(1,1)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,BLKSIZE=0)
D//SMPOUT    DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(MOD,PASS),SPACE=(CYL,(100,10)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FBA,LRECL=121,BLKSIZE=0)
D//SMPRPT    DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,DISP=(MOD,PASS),SPACE=(CYL,(100,10)),
D//             DCB=(RECFM=FBA,LRECL=121,BLKSIZE=0)
D//SMPPTS    DD UNIT=SYSALLDA,SPACE=(TRK,(1,1,1))
D//SMPLOG    DD DUMMY
D//SMPLOGA   DD DUMMY
D//SMPSNAP   DD DUMMY
D//*
D//
* End of WISH.
